title: Wanru(Ruby) Liu
text:
I am Wanru Liu, a Ph.D. student in Health Services Research at Brown University School of Public Health. My research lies at the intersection of health economics, aging, and health policy, with a particular focus on Medicare, long-term care, and payment reform.
My academic and research experiences span across multiple institutions including Harvard Kennedy School, MIT Sloan, and Tsinghua University. I have conducted both quantitative and qualitative work in healthcare evaluation, payment systems, and chronic disease management.
If you’d like to connect, feel free to email me at wanru_liu@brown.edu

title: Wanru(Ruby) Liu
text: I am Wanru (Ruby) Liu, a Ph.D. student in Health Services Research at Brown University School of Public Health. My research lies at the intersection of health economics, aging, and health policy, with particular interests in Medicare, long-term care, and payment reform. I am especially passionate about understanding how healthcare systems adapt to population aging and how policy can better support older adults with chronic conditions such as Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias.

title: Wanru(Ruby) Liu
text:
Experience
I currently work with Dr. Eric Jutkowitz and Dr. Kali Thomas to examine Medicare Advantage and Fee-for-Service switching patterns among older adults transitioning into assisted living, using national datasets with a focus on dementia care policy. My previous work includes evaluating China’s 2017 provider payment reform using interrupted time series analysis, conducting simulation modeling at Boston Children’s Hospital, and leading meta-analyses on chronic disease interventions at Tsinghua University.
Earlier in my academic career, I collaborated on large-scale data visualizations of Chinese philanthropic giving during the COVID-19 pandemic, and participated in clinical trials evaluating Traditional Chinese Medicine for schizophrenia. My undergraduate honors thesis explored how personality traits influence female college students’ perceived employability in China and the U.S.

title: Research
text: All of my research projects, including health economics, aging, policy reform, and care quality evaluations across the U.S. and China.

title: Switching Between Medicare Advantage and Fee-for-Service After Moving to Assisted Living
text: An analysis of Medicare plan switching patterns among older adults moving into assisted living, with emphasis on dementia care licensing, cognitive impairment, and stability of enrollment using national Medicare datasets.

title: The Impact of the 2017 Health Payment Reform in a Chinese City
text: A controlled interrupted time series evaluating efficiency and safety in Chinese public hospitals under DRG-based pay-for-performance, using SAS to assess hospital performance from 2014–2022.
